parts.title: Part 1 - Repeating Code
parts.description: In this video you will learn how we can repeat code using loops in Python and focus on while loops.

question1.text: The statements inside a while loop are executed:

options.text: As long as the loop condition is True
Only the first time the condition is checked
After the loop condition becomes False
A fixed number of times

question2.text: What is the basic structure of a while loop in Python?

options.text: Create variable inside the loop, test condition after the loop, update variable anywhere
Create variable before the loop, test variable in the condition, update variable inside the loop
Test condition before the loop, update variable before the loop, never change it
Create and update variable only after the loop ends

question3.text: What will happen if the condition of a while loop never becomes False?

options.text: The loop will stop automatically
Python will give an error
The loop will skip its statements
The program will run forever (infinite loop)

parts.title: Part 2 - While Loops
parts.description: In this video you will practice creating while loops in Python for different use cases.
keyConcepts: Entering the loop at least once

question1.text: What is the main difference between an if statement and a while loop?

options.text: Both test the condition only once
if tests the condition once; while tests it many times
while runs only if the condition is False
if keeps repeating until the condition changes

question2.text: Which of the following is NOT part of a correct while loop in Python?

options.text: Writing while followed by a Boolean condition
Using a colon (:) after the condition
Indenting the statements that belong inside the loop under the while line
Using parentheses () to enclose the statements inside the loop

question3.text: What will happen when this code runs?

options.text: Prints 1 to 4
Prints 1 and stops
Runs forever (Infinite loop)
Error
